name: bitingly
content:
bitingly adverb
(COLD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is so cold as to cause physical pain: bitingly cold It has been bitingly cold all week. In the mountains, the night air is bitingly cold.
More examplesFewer examplesThe days were beautiful and bright, but the nights were bitingly chilly.It was a bitingly cold but brilliant afternoon.She stepped out into the bitingly chill wind.

bitingly adverb
(CRITICAL)
in a way that criticizes someone or something or invites you to laugh at them, especially when this is funny and clever: bitingly funny The acclaimed novel is a bitingly funny satire of the recording industry. The drama takes a bitingly satirical look at middle-class family life.
More examplesFewer examplesThis is her most bitingly political work yet.She paints a bitingly witty picture of the corporate world."Stop behaving like my mother," she said bitingly.
